title: Third victim reportedly dies after Pawtucket ice rink shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Gerald Dorgan, 75, died after being critically injured in a Feb. 16 shooting at Dennis M. Lynch Arena, Pawtucket.
Gerald and Rhonda Dorgan, and Aidan Dorgan were killed in a family dispute shooting by ex-husband Robert Dorgan.
Robert Dorgan died by suicide after killing family members and being disarmed by three citizens at the hockey game.

title: Cat saved after days stuck in a tree following the blizzard that blanketed Rhode Island
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matt Lyons rescued Pixie, a cat stuck 50 feet up in a tree for two days after Rhode Island's blizzard.
Local authorities advised contacting tree services as police, fire, and animal control couldn't assist in the rescue.
Pixie was finally brought down safely using a backpack and returned to her owner, doing well after the ordeal.

title: 4 questions facing Bruins as they return from Olympic break
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins will resume their season against Columbus after a break, with 25 games remaining and currently in a playoff spot.
Despite strong offensive performances, Bruins face challenges with their penalty kill and high penalty minutes, ranking low in both areas.
Trade deadline decisions loom for the Bruins, with potential moves involving prospects and current players affecting playoff chances.

title: Fire erupts at MCI-Norfolk prison, no major injuries reported
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A fire at MCI-Norfolk prison was quickly extinguished with no major injuries reported.
One staff member and three inmates received medical attention for smoke inhalation from the fire.
Officials are investigating the cause of the fire and assessing damage to determine any housing impact.

title: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as an MVP candidate
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as an NBA MVP candidate citing his performance without Jayson Tatum.
The Boston Celtics hold a 38-19 record, ranking second in the Eastern Conference despite being labeled a 'bridge' season.
Jaylen Brown averages 29.2 points, 7.0 rebounds, 4.9 assists per game, elevating his MVP profile and the Celtics' success.

title: Harvard professor on leave as college investigates ties to Jeffrey Epstein
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Harvard professor Martin Nowak on leave pending investigation into ties with Jeffrey Epstein, confirmed by university statement.
Epstein donated $6.5 million to support Nowak's Harvard Program for Evolutionary Dynamics, which closed in 2021.
Nowak visited Epstein's island and granted him Harvard office access; DOJ documents reveal extensive contacts.

title: Malden educator, basketball coach charged with rape in incident involving high school student, officials say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Malden educator and basketball coach Scott Marino charged with rape involving a high school student, court records show.
Marino faces two counts of rape, indecent assault, and providing alcohol to a minor, according to Woburn District Court.
Malden Public Schools placed Marino on leave after being informed of the investigation by police on February 19.

title: Red Sox’ Wilyer Abreu explains viral broken-bat check swing
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Wilyer Abreu's bat broke during a check swing against the Pirates, going viral on social media.
Abreu speculated the bat was compromised from a previous at-bat due to odd sensations when hitting.
The Red Sox right fielder hopes to improve after a 2025 season with 22 home runs and a Golden Glove award.

title: All Mass. customers should have power fully restored by end of Friday night, Eversource says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Eversource aims to restore power to all affected Eastern Massachusetts customers by midnight Friday after Monday's blizzard.
Approximately 160,000 customers are currently without power, including 121,000 on Cape Cod and Martha's Vineyard.
Workers from Canada, New Hampshire, and Ohio are assisting, with crews working 18-hour shifts to restore power.

title: Team USA captain Hilary Knight reacts to Trump’s ‘distasteful’ joke about U.S. women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA women's hockey captain Hilary Knight called Trump’s comment about their team a 'distasteful joke' overshadowing their achievements.
The U.S. women's hockey team declined an invitation to Trump's State of the Union, citing scheduling conflicts after the Olympics.
Bruins and Team USA goaltender Jeremy Swayman apologized for the men's team laughing at Trump's comment, emphasizing respect for the women's team.
